description:
The `Radio` component is used for the selection of a single option from a set. Unfortunately
the `Radio` component must always be controlled because of the `FontIcon` toggles and how
the `radio` input type works. It is recommended to use the `SelectionControlGroup` component
to manage the `radio`.

id.description:
An id to use with the radio. This is used for accessibility and so that the label
triggers the radio toggle.

style.description: An optional style to apply to the radio's container.

className.description: An optional className to apply to the radio's container.

label.description:
A label to display with the radio. This is required for accessibility and triggering
the toggle.

labelBefore.description: Boolean if the label should appear before the radio icon.

name.description: A name to use for the `Radio`. This is required for accessibility.

onChange.description:
A function to call when the `Radio` triggers the `change` event. The `onChange` callback
will include the current value of the checked `radio` and the change event.

```js
onChange(changeEvent.target.value, changeEvent);
```

checked.description: A boolean if the `Radio` is currently checked.

inline.description: Boolean if the `Radio` should be displayed inline.

checkedIconChildren.description: Any children to use for the checked `FontIcon` of the `Radio`.

checkedIconClassName.description: An icon className to use for the checked `FontIcon` of the `Radio`.

uncheckedIconChildren.description: Any children to use for the unchecked `FontIcon` of the `Radio`.

uncheckedIconClassName.description: An icon className to use for the unchecked `FontIcon` of the `Radio`.

type.name: custom
type.raw:
deprecated(
  PropTypes.node,
  'Use the `checkedIconChildren` and `checkedIconClassName` props instead.'
)

type.name: custom
type.raw:
deprecated(

  'Use the `uncheckedIconChildren` and `uncheckedIconClassName` props instead.'
